page.title: 05Farming 2
page.content: { Trevillet Parc Trout Farm. The Trout Farm is in Rocky Valley and was constructed by building a dam and pools and diverting the water from a stream.This flows through the pools and rejoins the stream near the old Mill House,now a restaurant. Fingaling or fry are bought in to be grown on.They are kept in three ponds and fed on pellets containing protein, fatteners and binders.The trout are Rainbow Trout.It takes 1 year to grow them to their correct size for sale, which is 12 ozs. 60% of the sales are at the gate.40% of the trout are sold to hotels and restaurants in an area between Newquay and Liskeard.The trout farm has 8000 fish.People can go and catch their own in a special pond. The present price per pound is Â£1.30.
